intro: Tetranthera khasyana, commonly known as the Khasi tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves, typical of the genus Tetranthera. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
